p:
Lipolysis rates were obtained based on the assumptions described below because ELSD often provides a power function equation for the calibration curve as suggested [ 33, 34, 35]. Calibration curve can obtain from concentration (mg/mL) of injected lipid versus detector response (area) of ELSD. The peak area from ELSD would be considered as A = aC b, where A is the peak area of sample, C is the sample concentration, and a and b are coefficients. In this experiment, triundecanoin was used as an internal standard (IS). Hence, the power function equation was converted to
(1)
A
TTGS
/

= a

)
b
where A TTGS/A IS is the area ratio between total TAG species (TTGS) in each oil and IS, and C TTGS/C IS is the concentration ratio between them.
